INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206-1 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing contact
with children or parents to be a person who has the ability, experience,
education and training to perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A loaded gun was found in the driveway and staff put it in the dumpster
and did not report to law enforcement. This occurred on 1/5/2023.
Investigation Chief Administrator (CA) was advised of new complaint via email on
January 11, 2023.
CA was interviewed via telephone on January 11, 2023. CA stated
there was an incident some time in December 2022 where a staff
2

member found a loaded gun in the driveway of the independent living
(IL) house. The staff member contacted the police who responded and
took the gun.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 12, 2023.
Complainant stated she is Youth A’s aftercare worker, and it was
reported to her. She stated Youth A reported that she has found guns in
the driveway on 2 different occasions and staff threw them away
without reporting it. Complainant stated Youth A also witnessed
someone being shot while she was attempting to enter the IL house.
Complainant stated she contacted Staff 1 to discuss the concerns that
were reported to her but has not received a response.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the IL house on January 13,
2023. She stated she was not present at the IL house the day the gun
was discovered. Staff 1 stated the house next door shares a driveway
with the IL house and has had a lot of renovations lately so there have
been a lot of construction workers going in and out.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the IL house on January 13,
2023. She stated on December 14, 2022, she had arrived at the IL
house mid-morning and walked to the front entrance of the house and
saw a red gun laying in the driveway. She stated it resembled an old-
fashioned toy gun and was painted bright red. Staff 2 stated she picked
it up and it was heavier than she expected but based on appearance
thought it was toy and threw it away in the trash can on the side of the
house. She stated she conveyed what happened to the staff member
on the next shift as well as her husband who encouraged her to contact
the law enforcement, which she did the following morning.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on January 18, 2023. Youth
A stated a Staff 2 had told her and the other residents that she saw a
fully loaded gun in the driveway and did not know what to do with it, so
she threw it away. Youth A initially stated she did not see the gun,
however later in the conversation stated that she did see it and
described it to be a silver handgun laying in the middle of the driveway.
Later she again stated she did not see it but was told about it by Staff 2.
She stated the following day she was leaving home and saw a red gun
in the driveway. She stated it appeared to be real.
Documents reviewed:
 Samaritas West incident report dated December 22, 2022.
Incident report states Staff 2 found a loaded gun in the driveway
of the IL house. Staff 2 called Grand Rapids Police Department
who responded to the home and removed the weapon. Police
report 22-070805
4

 Reviewed personnel files for Staff 1 and Staff 2. There is nothing
in either file other than documents required prior to hire.
 Grand Rapids Police Department report #22-070805. Report
indicates an officer was dispatched to IL house the morning of
December 15, 2022, due to Staff 2 finding a gun in the driveway
the previous morning. Staff 2 reported to law enforcement she
threw the gun in the trash as she thought it was a toy based on
its appearance. The report notes the gun was a black and red
revolver and was determined to be real and was loaded with 6
bullets.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Staff 1 did find a gun that she
thought was a toy and threw it away. Staff 1 contacted law enforcement
the next day to report this incident who responded and confirmed the
gun was real and took the gun to dispose of safely.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
